intro: [WRONG START] Styrophyllum anomalum, commonly known as the tropical sea fan, is a unique marine plant belonging to the order Gorgonaria. It is characterized by its branching, calcareous skeleton and soft, fleshy polyps that extend from its branches. This species thrives in shallow, warm waters and is often found in coral reef environments. Stylophyllum anomalum plays a crucial role in providing habitat for various marine organisms.
